title: links for 2006-02-02
content:
• Make your own Ringtones
    Remember to cut it down to mono. With this capability, I'm surprised there's a ringtone industry whatsoever.
    (tags: mobile ringtones)
  • BBC NEWS | UK | Speed-texter beats world record
    This, again, makes me wonder if some sort of morse code interface might be desirable on a mobile device?
    (tags: mobile sms records)
  • howto-qmail-procmail.txt
    Checking out how to get procmail working with qmail, in anticipation of setting up a moblog-by-email script.
    (tags: qmail procmail unix sysadmin)
  • jwz - GLTerminal
    "It's pretty sweet, though not as faithful a simulation of a CRT as Trevor Blackwell's fantastic Apple ][ screen saver (in xscreensaver)."
    (tags: nifty software hacks retro oldschool computing)
  • I blog therefore I am | Please Guido, pick me, pick me!
    Hee hee, I'm glad someone said it: "But hurry up, many leading web framework developers are pleading their case and you don't want to be last."
    (tags: webdev python)
  • 365 tomorrows - We All Fall Down
    "On the eighteenth day the sun didn't rise, we locked ourselves in our homes and apartments."
    (tags: scifi stories writing)
  • President Creates Cabinet-Level Position To Coordinate Scandals | The Onion - America's Finest News Source
    "In his State of the Union address to the nation last night, President Bush announced a new cabinet-level position to coordinate all current and future scandals facing his party."
    (tags: politics bush funny)
  • 0xDECAFBAD
    Friends don't let friends drink decaf.
    (tags: programming coffee caffeine)

Archived Comments

  • Pete Prodoehl
    2006-02-02T19:54:33

    My Nokia phones lets me use any MP3 as a ringtone. I just transfer the file via Bluetooth from my Mac to the phone and select it. As I recall hearing, many phones/providers don't allow this because of all the potential money they can make off of selling ringtones.

        </li>

    </ul>

    </div>
